item.description: A Simple Guide to Writing Your Abstract Step 1: Plan Consider what you want to present â€“ you might want to focus on a particular aim or aspect of your research, or present an overview of the whole project. It can help to discuss the focus of your abstract with your supervisor and/or peers before you start writing. The format is flexible, so donâ€™t worry if you donâ€™t have much (or any) data to present.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: Tanka Theme Demo
item.description: Tanka is a Bootstrap-based minimalist theme for Hugo. Vik, Iceland. Photo by Adam Jang. Typography Follows the Bootstrap typography. h1 Heading h2 Heading h3 Heading h4 Heading h5 Heading h6 Heading This is bold text This is bold text This is italic text This is italic text Deleted text Block quotes are written like so. They can span multiple paragraphs, if you like. Some text, and some code and then a nice plain link with title .

Image adapted from www.freepik.com About What is the WEHI Student Symposium? The WEHI Student Symposium (WSS) is a one-day event for WEHI students to showcase their fantastic science either in short talk or poster format. It is also a student-led initiative: organised for students by students! (plus our awesome post-doc advisers ðŸ˜„) When will it be held? Monday 14th of November 2022 (start/finish times TBA) Where will it be held?
Abstract submission Abstract submissions for the 2022 WEHI Student Symposium closed on Friday the 19th of August 2022.

Pyroptosis inhibiting nanobodies block Gasdermin D pore formation Gasdermin D (GSDMD) is a key mediator of pyroptosis, a pro-inflammatory form of cell death occurring downstream of inflammasome activation as part of the innate immune defence. Upon cleavage by inflammatory caspases, the N-terminal domain of GSDMD forms pores in the cell membrane resulting in cytokine release and eventually cell death. Targeting GSDMD is an attractive way to dampen inflammation. In this study, six GSDMD targeting nanobodies were characterized in terms of their binding affinity, stability, and effect on GSDMD pore formation.
Instructions for presenters Instructions for presenters will become available closer to the date. Please check back later.

Program 9.00 - 9.20: Registration Come to the registration desk located in the L7 Tapestry Lounge to collect a nametag and paper program! 9.20 - 9.30: Introduction In the Davis Auditorium 9.30 - 11.15: Session 1 (Long Talks) Maggie Potts: Genome wide CRISPR/Cas9 knockout screens in vivo identify GATOR1 components as tumour suppressors in EÎ¼-MYC lymphoma development Lejla Kartal: Immunity to malaria: association between antibodies and clinical protection in Plasmodium vivax low-endemic areas

Registration For students who have submitted an abstract, please know that the abstract submission form includes registration. There is no need to fill in an additional form. Registrations for the 2022 WEHI Student Symposium closed on Friday the 4th of November 2022.
